Spatial Design

from painting to space






NOTE OF INTENT


DESIGN BRIEF:
Create a space inspired from the composition and the colour range of a cubist painting.
STEP 0 - Two dimensions. Analyse the composition of the painting.
STEP 1 - Frontal perspective. Create a bas-relief carving.
STEP 2 - Multiple perspectives. Create a spatial structure on a stand.
STEP 3 - Multiple perspectives. Create a space, scale 1:50.

PROJECT:
A corridor leads to a park with an ornamented giant spyglass.

DEVELOPMENT :
STEP 0 - PAINTING

MENACE. 1938. Le Corbusier. Painting. Oil on canvas.





STEP 1 - BAS-RELIEF CARVING

STEP 1 - Bas-Relief Carving



PROCESS - Layers in tracing paper and foamcore





STEP 2 - SPATIAL SCULPTURE

STEP 2 - Spatial Sculpture





STEP 3 - SPACE

STEP 3 - Space (entrance)



STEP 3 - Space (park)



STEP 3 - Space (spyglass)
